org.deeplearning4j.arbiter.optimize.api

Interface CandidateGenerator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseCandidateGenerator, GridSearchCandidateGenerator, RandomSearchGenerator

    public interface CandidateGenerator
    A CandidateGenerator proposes candidates (i.e., hyperparameter configurations) for evaluation. This abstraction allows for different ways of generating the next configuration to test; for example, random search, grid search, Bayesian optimization methods, etc.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Candidate getCandidate()
      Generate a candidate hyperparameter configuration
      java.lang.Class<?> getCandidateType() 
      ParameterSpace<?> getParameterSpace() 
      boolean hasMoreCandidates()
      Is this candidate generator able to generate more candidates? This will always return true in some cases, but some search strategies have a limit (grid search, for example)
      void reportResults(OptimizationResult result)
      Report results for the candidate generator.
      void setRngSeed(long rngSeed) 

    • Method Detail

      • hasMoreCandidates

        boolean hasMoreCandidates()
        Is this candidate generator able to generate more candidates? This will always return true in some cases, but some search strategies have a limit (grid search, for example)

      • getCandidate

        Candidate getCandidate()
        Generate a candidate hyperparameter configuration

      • reportResults

        void reportResults(OptimizationResult result)
        Report results for the candidate generator.
        Parameters:
        result - The results to report

      • getParameterSpace

        ParameterSpace<?> getParameterSpace()
        Returns:
        Get the parameter space for this candidate generator

      • setRngSeed

        void setRngSeed(long rngSeed)
        Parameters:
        rngSeed - Set the random number generator seed for the candidate generator

      • getCandidateType

        java.lang.Class<?> getCandidateType()
        Returns:
        The type (class) of the generated candidates
